page.title: 08Burscough-Work on a Farm
page.content: by Barbara I get up at 7:00 and the workmen arrive for work at 7:30.We grow three combineable crops;wheat,barley and protein peas. We usually start with winter barley in the last week in July and finish with the spring barley in late August or into September in a wet year. During the day I get a chance to do a wide range of jobs.Before we combine any crops we walk over it looking for wild oats.Wild oats are a nuiscance because they lower the standard of the crop.During the summer my sister and I have "wild oated" about 200 acres of land. Most of my time I spend round the farm looking after the drier.The drier conditions the crop until it is below 16% moisture.
